p: Seven of the syndrome TS in this study had a linear trend and all 16 syndrome TS had seasonality, however, the syndrome TS peaked in different seasons (see Table 2 and Figure 1). The main differences between these syndrome TS were the length of historical data available, which ranged from slightly less than 3 years to more than 7 years; and the average number of reports per week that varied from a low of 2.6 for ASR_OTHER_calves to a high of 891 for AMD_mortality_calves. An interesting observation was that in general the coefficient of variation (CV) was greater for syndrome TS with smaller average weekly counts. All syndrome TS with counts >100 counts/week had on average a CV of <0.30. All syndrome TS with average weekly counts around or <100 had CV values of >0.39.
